intro: Santiria kamerunensis, commonly known as Cameroon santiria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments along forest floors or in undergrowth. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though more research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
